content.user_title: Build ChatGPT Apps with Interactive Widgets
content.value_statement: Building ChatGPT Apps requires understanding widget architecture, MCP server setup, and the window.openai API. This skill provides complete guidance on creating rich interactive experiences with embedded widgets that communicate through sendFollowUpMessage, toolOutput, and callTool APIs.
actual_capabilities: Create MCP servers with FastMCP for ChatGPT App tools
Design HTML widgets with inline CSS and JavaScript
Implement window.openai APIs: sendFollowUpMessage, toolOutput, callTool
Configure response metadata with openai.com/widget embedded resources
Set up ngrok tunnels for local server exposure
Register apps in ChatGPT Developer Mode
limitations: Widget buttons may render as static elements in sandboxed iframes
External CSS files may not load reliably
Complex JavaScript interactions may not work consistently
Requires ngrok or similar tunneling for ChatGPT access

use_cases.title: Build Custom ChatGPT Apps
use_cases.description: Create full-featured ChatGPT Apps with rich interactive widgets for specialized use cases like readers, dashboards, and data visualizations.

use_cases.title: Interactive Content Widgets
use_cases.description: Design widgets for interactive books, tutorials, and learning experiences with navigation and action buttons.

use_cases.description: Build MCP servers that expose custom tools with embedded UI components for seamless user interactions within ChatGPT.

prompt_templates.title: Create Basic Widget
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a basic ChatGPT App widget using FastMCP. Show me the project structure, main.py template with widget resource, and a simple HTML widget that uses window.openai.toolOutput.

prompt_templates.title: Add Action Buttons
prompt_templates.prompt: Add action buttons to my ChatGPT App widget. Use sendFollowUpMessage to trigger follow-up prompts when buttons are clicked. Include three example buttons: Summarize, Explain, and Quiz.

prompt_templates.title: Debug Widget Issues
prompt_templates.prompt: My ChatGPT App widget is showing Loading... indefinitely. Check the server logs and response metadata. What could cause this and how do I fix it?

prompt_templates.title: Widget Registry Pattern
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to implement a widget registry pattern in FastMCP to manage multiple widgets like table-of-contents and chapter-reader that can be dynamically selected.

output_examples.input: Create a ChatGPT App widget with action buttons
output: Your widget HTML should include buttons with event listeners that call window.openai.sendFollowUpMessage
The MCP server response must include _meta["openai.com/widget"] with an EmbeddedResource containing text/html+skybridge
Use optional chaining: if (window.openai?.sendFollowUpMessage) before calling
For development, expose your server via ngrok and register in ChatGPT Developer Mode

best_practices: Always use optional chaining for window.openai APIs to handle missing availability gracefully
Keep widgets self-contained with all HTML, CSS, and JavaScript in a single file
Use sendFollowUpMessage for reliable action button interactions in sandboxed iframes
anti_patterns: Relying on external CSS files that may not load in the widget environment
Using complex JavaScript like window.getSelection() that may not work in sandboxes
Skipping the _meta["openai.com/widget"] response metadata which is required for widget rendering

faq.question: What tools can I use this skill with?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code for building ChatGPT Apps.

faq.question: What are the technical limits for ChatGPT widgets?
faq.answer: Widgets must use inline CSS, all content in one file, and communicate via window.openai APIs only.

faq.question: How do I connect my local server to ChatGPT?
faq.answer: Use ngrok or similar tunneling software to expose localhost:8001, then register the /mcp endpoint.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only generates templates and documentation. No data is sent to external services.

faq.question: Why are my widget changes not appearing?
faq.answer: ChatGPT aggressively caches widgets. Delete the app, restart ngrok for a new URL, and recreate the app.

faq.question: How does this differ from standard MCP servers?
faq.answer: ChatGPT Apps require widget resources with text/html+skybridge MIME type and _meta response metadata.
